title: How to Break in Leather Ballet Shoes

methods.name: Basic stretching for new ballet flats

steps.headline: Grab your new ballet flats.
steps.description: Head to a clear and clean space to stretch the flats.

steps.headline: Spray the shoes with the water.
steps.description: Spray the front, left and right sides. Spray the back as well. Ensure that the entire outer area of the shoes is damp.

steps.headline: Aim the hair dryer at the shoes.
steps.description: Start with the front, pulling on the toe front as you dry it.

steps.headline: Repeat on the sides and the back, pulling the shape outward as you dry.
Repeat as necessary.
steps.description: The shoes should stretch enough in a short space of time.

methods.name: Advanced stretching to fit a smaller pair

steps.headline: Get a size smaller than usual for this method.
steps.description: When shopping for new ballet slippers, don't be tempted to buy the ones that fit with room to spare, get a size down and stretch them to fit your foot exactly. Buy a pair of leather ballet shoes in a size lower than your normal size.

steps.headline: Take off any elastic straps on the ballet shoes.
Try to fit the shoe on your foot.
steps.description: It should be very very tight, even painfully so.

steps.headline: Using rescue oil or bio-oil, rub the full leather exterior of the shoe.
Get a wooden spoon, and push it into the toe part of the shoe.
steps.description: Push it until it stretches as far as it will go.

steps.headline: Do the same for the heel of the shoe.
Whilst the shoe is oily still, put on two pairs of thick socks.
steps.description: Pull your ballet slippers on––it will be a bit of a challenge, but persevere. Put on another pair of socks over the shoes.

steps.headline: Walk around in the shoes for an hour or two, until they are dry.
Place the shoes in a warm place.
steps.description: Repeat the whole process a few hours later, and leave in a warm place each time.

steps.headline: With one pair of socks on, slip on the shoe.
steps.description: Mark where to put elastics on, then take off and sew them in.

steps.headline: Wear your shoes all the time when you're at home.
steps.description: In about a week's time they will soften and mould exactly to your feet, leaving perfect fitting ballet shoes that will last you for ages.
